description:
Hi everyone. Aryan in Amsterdam set up this group as a vehicle for group travel in Europe - and I for one thought hte idea ws excellent. I went to the Amsterdam weekend at end Feb and had a fabulous time. However I was surprised I was the only one out of over 100 people! What happened folks?

Anyway after talking it over with Aryan we thought it would be nice if we had a london based meet to see what the group wanted to do. Arjan is thinking of organising a group visit to London for the Notting Hill Festival which could be very cool and of course next stop could be any of a number of cool cities in Europe Paris Rome Madrid Barcelon etc.

I'm suggesting a date to meet up after the 1st bank holiday to see what hte interest is.

Depending on who is there and how we are for time and what's on at thesouthbank we could takea stroll along the thames towards Tower Bridge or go get food in giraffe piza express or strada or the real greak (southwark Bridge)
name: get to know each other over a coffee

description:
What kind of Weekendtrip is this?

Amsterdam Uitmarkt highlights the start of the Cultural Indoor Season. In July and August people in Amsterdam Area tend to enjoy the nice weather - or just wait for it to happen! But in September it's cultural activities all over the place again, and in the last weekend of August all artists, actors and performers show what they have got on Amsterdam Uitmarkt! There all all kind of cultural activities on the pavements, streets and channels of Amsterdam, and YOU want to be there!

Read more here => http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uitmarkt

- What kind of event is this?-

On Friday August 27 at 6PM all people that are coming over to Amsterdam for the weekend, or for a part of the weekend, can meet and greet at Restaurant Guadalupe. This venue is very close to Amsterdam Central Station. This event is just a small meet and greet - no need to order dinner!

EVERYONE that will be coming to Amsterdam during a part of this weekend can sign up for this event in order to see who's coming and in order to make plans together - so also if you wont be in Amsterdam already at Friday at 6PM you can sign up here :) 

Events inside the Culti Group

Please join the Amsterdam Chapter of Culti Meetup Group and sign up for the events you'd like to attend to during this weekend!

Friday: Dinner at Poco Loco and visiting Uitmarkt afterward => http://www.meetup.com/cultiA/events/26283751/

Saturday: Connecting Singles at Leidseplein => http://www.meetup.com/cultiA/events/19838181/

Sunday: Lunch, Hermitage and Visiting Uitmarkt => http://www.meetup.com/cultiA/events/22459021/

Accomodation

In Amsterdam area there are lots of locations for your accommodation available - it goes from camping sites on bikeable distance to top of the bill hotels. The Culti Group does not take care of accommodation, but if you need help finding accommodation just drop Arjan an E-Mail! :)

This will be a GREAT weekend in Amsterdam! So.... Sign up and be there! :)
how_to_find_us: Look for the Meetup Sign or call Arjan on 06 - 46 28 56 30
name: Amsterdam Uitmarkt Weekendtrip

group.name: Culti Group Belgium: New in Town & Local Languages

description:
What Kind of Event is the Global Local Antwerpen Meetup?

The Global Local Antwerpen Meetup is an event where people lifing or staying in Antwerpen Area meet and mingle! Nationality, religious identity, cultural identity.. It doesn't mather! The only thing that mathers is having an international mindset. This meetup is for people that think global and act local :>

Where will this event take place?

We'll meet at the Paleis op de Meier, have a drink at the Paleis cafe, salivate to the mouth watering chocolates from Domink Persoon at the Chocolate Line, then continue on  to my art studio -just a stroll away! I'll make reservations if possible so please RSVP or unRSVP.
name: Global Local Antwerpen Meetup - Chocolate & Art

group.name: Culti Group Belgium: New in Town & Local Languages

description:
- Event Details -

The Mexican Wrap Boattrip Meetup will take place at a quit comfortable ship that departs from NDSM Area at 20:00. To take part in this event promises to be a unique experience - you can sail and eat! The menu is easy to explain - during the entire two and a halve hour cruise you can eat as much Mexican Wraps as you like - and the boattrip that comes with the deal is a special experience at itselve!

You will be on a boattrip over "Het IJ". Het IJ is the water between the Central Station, Muziekgebouw, KNSM Eiland and Amsterdam Noord. In this time of year the view on the Skyline is very beautiful indeed, so it's easy to say that you get the Mexican Wraps for free on top of taking this boattrip :)

- Program -

6:45 => Meet in front of Starbucks Central Station Amsterdam

7:05 => Take the Ferry to NDSM Area

7:30 => First drinks at NDSM Area onshore

8:00 => Sail and Eat

10:30 => Take the Ferry back to Central Station

11:00 => Last drink close to Central Station

Costs

Eur 28,- in cash. This price is for the cruise, and for one drink, and for the costs of organization. If we are with a big group than the price will be lower.

What more needs to be said?

You DON'T want to miss this event!

venue.name: Amsterdam CS - In front of Starbucks

how_to_find_us: Look for Arjan
name: Amsterdam Mexican Wrap Cruise

description:
- What kind of event is this? -

Scheveningen Pier, In The Hague / Rotterdam Area, is THE One Million Dollar Pier of The Netherlands... Lots of people have kissed eachother on this Very location! Even more turned eachother down here :>

Still there is a real chance this pier will be destructed, because every stakeholder wants another stakeholder to pay for renovating this place....

Let's take a look at this indoor plus outdoor and therefor weatherproof location while it's still there!

Costs

The costs for this event are EUR 5,- ( in cash only). This is for one drink plus for the costs of organization. The drink will be a hot drink, or an alcohol free softdrink. Please don't show up drunk or drink alcholic drinks before dinner time. The organizer wants everyone to be on the same level. Thanks in advance :)

How to find the Group

For finding the venue call 070-3814901. Ones inside look for Arjan or look for the Meetup Sign.

Program

We will all meet in Eden Babylon at 3PM. Everyone will get one drink and after this we will all go to Scheveningen by public transport. In Scheveningen, we'll sightsee ALL over this pier - and after this we will have dinner together in one of the many nice venues Scheveningen has to offer! If more than 16 people show up, than the group will be split up in several small ones.

 -Famous Last Words-

Let's have a nice day on this Pier PLUS spend our money there... It might make a difference for saving this unique pier! :)
how_to_find_us: For finding the venue call 070-3814901. Ones inside look for Arjan or look for the Meetup Sign.
name: Discover Scheveningen Pier!

group.name: Culti Group Belgium: New in Town & Local Languages

description:
- What kind of Event is this? -

Noon wants to stay at home on Second Pentacost day! Right?

But, if so.... Than how to make plans in a country like NL? Simple! For Second Pentacost Day, there will be two plans, the bad weather plan and the nice weather plan. If you like both plans, than just sign up for both plans!

One of these two plans will take place, but not both.

The Plan

This daytrip will start with getting together very close to the Central Station, Amsterdam. From the Central Station, we will take the bus ( public transport ) to Marken. So... Don't forget to take a OV Chip Card with you! If you don't have one, you can buy one on the central station.

In Marken, we will do some sight seeing! After this, we'll travel to Volendam using the Marken Express => http://www.markenexpress.nl/. Read more about Marken : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marken.

- Volendam -

In Volendam, ones again we will take a look around before we enter one of the local restaurants to enjoy Dutch cuisine - which is fish :) . After eating some fish we might visit one of the local pubs, which will be the last stop before going home. Read more about Volendam : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volendam

Costs

The costs of organization for this event are EUR 1,50. This fee needs to be paid after leaving the Lobby Bar. This fee does not include drinks, food or the costs or travveling.

Famous Last Words

Meet Culti People, Meet New People, be out of town for a day.... Don't hesistate - Sign Up!
how_to_find_us: Look for Arjan in this bar. For finding the venue where we first meet, call 020-5300800.
name: Second Pentacost Day: Daytrip to Marken and Volendam

group.name: Culti Group Belgium: New in Town & Local Languages

description:
- What kind of event is Muiden and Pampus? -

Pampus is an island in between Amsterdam. Muiden and Almere. It's one of the main touristic attractions in Amsterdam area - and there is only one way to go there.... By boat!

Muiden is a small and very authentic city that's also in between Amsterdam and Almere.

On just one day, we'll visit Pampus first and Muiden later! Siteseeing at Pampus first, dinner in Muiden later.

Guided Tour and how to get to Muiden

On the island, there is a guided tour available. The guided tour is in Dutch, your host Arjan will try to translate some details for you. We''ll travel to Muiden by public transport, which wont take long and wont cost much.

- Costs -

The costs are EUR 20, to be paid in cash only in Amstelstation at the start of the day. This EUR 20 is EUR 1,50 for The costs of Organization, EUR 17,50 for the boattrip from Muiden to Pampus and back( entrance fee for the island included) and EUR 1,-- each goes to charity. Together this makes EUR 20,-.

On top of this, you need to pay for all your drinks and food through out the day. Also you need an OC chip card with at least EUR 7,-- on it, for getting to Muiden and back from the Amstel Station.

The Donations

Arjan will donate one Euro each to The Amsterdam Voedselbank. Read more about Arjan's Donation Policy right here.

Rules

Based on experience only one rule needs to be mentioned: don't drink and daytrip. More information about this drinking rule-can be found here. Other than this common sense should cover it all. We're all adults.

And now... Let's Meetup and have some fun :)

venue.name: Amsterdam Amstel Railroad Station in front of Albert Heijn

how_to_find_us: Look for the Meetup Sign
name: Daytrip to Pampus and Muiden

group.name: Culti Group Belgium: New in Town & Local Languages

description:
- What does a Culti Daytrip look like? -

We travel by public transport. A bad weather, normal weather and excellent weather program is prepared. For normal weather a standard program is being prepared, if the weather is more than amazing we'll go the the beach, and if the weather is deep down cruel on us again, than we'll go to a museum.

The Final Choice for August

The final choice for August is Zaanse Schans. To visit Zaanse Schans is a must-have-seen for everyone in the area! Not bringing your camera would be soooo wrong :). Read more about this fantastic destination right here => http://www.zaanseschans.nl/. After seeing Zaanse Schans and Zaanse Schans area - we'll go to the center of Zaandam, in fact we'll go to the building on the picture below. After this, we'll have dinner in the center of Zaandam together.

 - Costs -

The costs for the Zaanse Schans Trip are EUR 12,--. These costs are made up off out of: EUR 3,- for seeing the mills from the inside, EUR 6.-- for a one hour cruise by boat through the Zaanse Schans Area, EUR 2,-- for the costs of organization and also there is a EUR 1,--donation for charity.

The Donations

Througout the entire summer, Arjan will collect money for the Amsterdam Foodbank. Read more about the results so far, about this local foodbank and about Arjan's Donation Policy right here.

- The Meetup Point in Amsterdam -

The Meetup point in Amsterdam is really easy to find, leave the central station on the city side using the central exit.Walk straight to town, towards Damrak. If you go like this, you can't miss this venue! It's on only one minute walking distance from the central station. If you need assistance, call Van Gogh Cafe on the number[masked] 5412.

- Famous Last Words -

Let's hope a day like this will make you feel like being out of the usual routine - if even it's just for a couple of hours :)
how_to_find_us: For finding the venue call 0031-20530 5412. Ones inside, look for Arjan or for the Meetup. More info in the event text.
name: August Culti Daytrip: Zaanse Schans

description:
- Daytrip to Düsseldorf! -

Some of us are here today, there tomorrow... Than why not get a one-day-impression of one the cities where your next life-chapter might take you?

Düsseldorf is the center of the International community in Nord Rhein Westfalen.

More and more Internationals move to this area! Discover the charm of Düsseldorf with Culti Group!

- OK.... But what will we do there? -

Our daytrip will start at Eindhoven. Culti Group Members from all chapters of Culti Group in Belgium and The Netherlands will gather in the lobby bar of the Holiday Inn. Which is very close to the Eindhoven Railroadstation. After a cup of coffee, we will travel together to Düsseldorf using the local train. Which means there is no hassle with booking a ticket at all.

In Düssseldorf, first we will have a meet and greet with the International Community of Düsseldorf because we will attend to the December Mulan Meetup in Düsseldorf! Later on, we will visit the local the Amazing Rheinturm! On the way there, we will go to a restaurant.

Around 9PM, we will go back to Eindhoven. That's where our daytrip will end around 11PM.

- How will we travel? -

We will use local trains. For the latest updates about this, the commantline will be used.

- Costs -

The costs will be EUR 1,50 for the Culti Contribution and EUR 1,- for the Fall Fundraizer. Together this makes EUR 2,50. In Dusseldorf there are two events planned, together with the Nord Rhein Westfalen Chapter of Culti Group. Each event you attend to in Düsseldorf is costing an additional Euro. Other than this: pay for your own drinks, and food, and so fort.

- Famous Last Words! -

Just Get Crazy! It's fun! Visit Düsseldorf with Culti Group on December 30, and come to Amsterdam on December 31 for the NYE Party in Amsterdam Zuid.... Why not? :)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

- RSVP Now or Later? -

A "Yes RSVP" for this event means you are reserving one of the available spots. Feel free to reserve a spot if you want to be there, but if plans change, than please show some respect to organizers and other members of this group. And clear the reservation for someone else. This also makes telling the venue owners how many people are going to be there a lot more easy :)

description:
- What kind of Event is this? -

"Weekendtrip to Barcelona" in early means: Walking on Sunshine! In this time of the year, the weather in Barcelona already makes one forget all about winter....

And other than that, there is SO much more to do and see in this fantastic city!

So why not take a look at the entire program that's set up for you by the Culti Group Organizers of Culti Group Amsterdam and Haarlem and Culti Group Barcelona?

- Accommodation -

Culti Group Amsterdam and Haarlem takes care of things to do and people to meet in Barcelona. Culti Group Amsterdam and Haarlem doesn't take care of accommodation, but this shouldn't mather to much. Expedia and lots of other websites offer flights to Barcelona, and hotels in Barcelona. BTW.... Before eastern, both tickets and hotels are well priced :)

Finding the way in Barcelona is very easy, because of the excellent subway system. All events will be set up close to subway stations!

 - How to Find Hotelbar Barcelona Catalonia? -

Just go to Subwaystation or railroadstation "Placa Espanya" and after leaving this station, look for or ask for the hotel "Barcelona Catalonia". Which btw is very easy to find after finding Placa Espanya :)

- Long weekend or Quick Weekend? -

Events will be set up starting on March 6 (Wednesday ) and ending on March 9 ( Saturday ). If you'd like to go to Barcelona only from Friday to sunday, or from Tuesday evening until early monday morning... It's all up to you!

- I want this! -

Than don't hesitate.... And sign up!

description:
- English Comedy Night - Tuesday, Apr 16 -

Good news for all! International Comedians are coming to town again!

Check all details in "The Invite"

- Information for those who want to meet other attendees to this meetup before the meetup -

Another meetup takes place in this group just around the corner. It's the Dutch Language meetup. Feel free to come to this meetup at 7:30 PM in order to meet other people who are going to this comedy event too..

- The Invite -

After the very successful show in march, here's our april show, with more great comedians, and a strong scandinavian presence this time.

Isak Janssson (SWE) is one of the foremost comedians on the Scandinavian circuit and widely known as the best Swedish comedian in English. Fresh of off his sell-out one man show in Stockholm called "Everything is the florists fault" he is ready to rock your world with the absurd, downright witty, and charmingly hilarious.

Sofie Hagen (DK) is one the fastest rising stars on the UK comedy circuit after moving to London last year. Already she acheived the following: Winner – Comedy Café New Act Competition 2012, Runner up – Best Urban Female Comedian 2012, Finalist – Funny Women 2012, Finalist – Danish Open in Stand-up 2012, Runner up – Leicester Square New Comedian 2012, Finalist - Piccadilly Comedy Club New Act of the Year 2013.

Rayen Panday (IND) is fresh off his one-man show selling out theatres in Amsterdam and is probably one of the most handsome comedians in Holland. A wonderful joke teller, and also an incredible singer as well as he mixes song into his act now and then - he has the entire package.

Hosted by: Neville Raven (UK) is an experienced London Stand-up Comedian, Radio presenter, Producer and Playwright. As a performer his storytelling style has engaged audiences all over the world. He is happy to play to a rowdy Club audience or a seated Theatre crowd, and his material is guaranteed to be full of surprising twists with a constant stream of laughs.

Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupapril(save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

When: Tues, Apr 16. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00
Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map:http://goo.gl/maps/01NPe)

Presented by INTERNATIONALCOMEDIANS.com, Radio X and the group facebook.com/standupbrussels
how_to_find_us: For those who want to meet other attendees to this meetup before the meetup: please check the text.

description:
- Brussels English Comedy Night: Tues, May 21 - Everything in English -

International Comedians.com is in town again on May 21 - and you should be there :)

- Costs -

Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupmay (save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

- The Invite -  

Join us again on Tuesday, May 21st for another great Brussels Comedy Night show with more great comedians and a crowd favourite returning for a visit.

Christian Schulte-Loh (Germany) visited us in February and raised the roof so much that we just can't get enough of him. He is a comedy superstar and has performed all over the world including Argentina, UK, Germany, Denmark, Slovakia, Hungary, Czech Republic, Holland, Belgium, and countless other countries, and hosts his own one-man show at the Edinburgh Fringe festival. He is known as one of the foremost foreign comedians on the UK comedy circuit and headlines clubs across Europe regularly.

Soula Notos (GRE) - Born and raised in Holland in a Greek family. Crisis indeed! She knows it by heart. Growing up with shouting and gesturing relatives (small bodies, lots of movement), the only relief was comedy. And now, close to her well deserved pension, she loves to tell stories filled with self-mockery to as many people as possible. She has performed at the Free Fringe in Edinburgh, in Manchester, at the International Women’s Festival in Greece and many clubs and venues across Europe. "Great Energy. Completely original." - Funny's Funny Comedian of the Year 2011 Highly Commended Act.

Louis Zezeran (AUS) - runs clubs in Finland and organized the very first Stand Up Comedy shows in Estonia, using the cleverly named title “Comedy Estonia”. Louis has a like-able connection with the audience when he performs. He often talks to the audience, making jokes with the crowd and letting them become part of the action. Louis likes to make fun of cultural differences, and have a poke at everyone.

Stewart Johnson (USA) - has a knack for picking out the obvious yet hidden quirks in society and turning them into laughs you will never forget. He is an American who is based in Estonia, and has a more mainstream, non-offensive style, frequently drawing upon his experiences as a father. A witty, observational style that will tickle every single one of your funny bones.

Hosted by Joe Eagan (CAN)

Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupmay (save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)
When: Tues, May 21. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map: http://goo.gl/maps/01NPe)
Presented internationalcomedians.com and https://www.facebook.com/standupbrussels

description:
- What kind of Event is this? -

"Culti's Delight" is the best day of the month! Because on this day you can meat like minded people - and you can experience how to combine basic fun and basic culture!

< = The Meeting Point

- Easy Meetup Point -

We'll meet in the most beautiful located Subway Cafetaria maybe in the entire world!

It's a very good place for drinks and food before going to Marken together. This venue is on the northern side of the Amsterdam Central Station, and next to the place where all ferries take of to Amsterdam Noord. It's also very close to the Amsterdam Central Busstation.

 

- Culti's Delight May: Marken Museum and Boattrip to Volendam -

The day starts with getting together in Amsterdam - and with taking the bus to Marken. Don't forget your OV Chipcard.

http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/9/d/0/event_10727568.jpegAfter arriving in the Marken/Volendam area, We'll take a fast and proper look together at the Marken Museum.

( => The 2010 daytrip to Volendam )

Free entrance for those with a museumcard! Without this card, the entrance fee is EUR2,50.

We'll also make a small walk in the village. Which really looks like the picture above. Lots of people wear traditional clothes on a daily basis.

On Marken, we'll also stop at a market stand kind of fishshop! Where the fish is being made in a traditional West Frisian way.

After this short visit to Marken, we'll take the Marken Express to Volendam. Inside Volendam, we'll have a drink while the event host will find the group a restaurant.

The day will end with taking the buss back to Amsterdam from Volendam.

- Culti Contribution -

A EUR 2,50 fee is required for attending to Culti's Delight. Read more about this Culti contribution right here. Other than this, you need around EUR 10,-- for the boat from Marken to Volendam, and for entering the museum. During the day you can pay for you own food and drinks.

The 2:30 PM Meetup Point in Amsterdam is in Resuaurant Guadalupe. For finding Guadalupe please call the venue at[masked] 14. Guadalupe is just left of the big church on the picture below. This church is very visisble if you leave the central station on the city side.

The 6PM Meetup point is at Oude Gracht, if you want to meet in Utrecht, than you will miss the city walk. But you won't miss dinner! For information on meeting in Utrecht, please follow this link.

- The Lunch -

Bread with butter and one drink is included in the price of this meetup. If you want to order more, than it's not included in the price of this meetup.

~~~~~~~

=> A Reinier Craeyvanger painting of Domtoren, Utrecht

~~~~~~~

- Program -

2:30 PM: Lunch in Amsterdam

4:00 PM: Arriving in Utrecht, City walk Stage 1

The city walk will include Oude Gracht, the old city moat and Domtoren.

We wont use an official map - we'll just use our smartphone's :). Also the host will bring some information.

4:45PM: A Drink next to Domtoren

5:15 PM: City Walk stage 2 ( The City walk ends at Utrecht Central Station )

6:00 PM: Optional - Join Culti Group Utrecht for Dinner, read more here.
how_to_find_us: For finding Guadalupe please call the venue at 003120 420 61 14. Guadalupe is just left of the big church on the picture below. This church is very visisble if you leave the central station on the city side. Ones inside look for the Meetup Sign.

Please scroll down to read more about the required level.

- How to Find? -

This meetup will take place at an easy to find venue, which is very close to subway station Merode. In this venue, it's possible to eat a little something - or to just have some drinks.

 

- What more needs to be said? -

Enjoy the Meetup!

######################################

=> The Meetup Point

- For those who already speak a bit of Dutch -

This meetup is a chance to have conversation in Dutch a lot more than it's a chance to practice and repeat sentences in order to get the basic right...

Having that said: everyone who at least understands what conversations in Dutch are about is invited to be there  :)

- PLease be punctual with your reservation -

Feel free to reserve a spot for this event, but please change your reservation from "Yes" to "No" in case plans change.

description:
- The New In Town Meetup Brussels  ( Everyone Welcome ) -

Let's Meet and Greet the New In Town! ( Less New in Town are just as welcome:)

In one of the best places to do so: Longitude Bar!

- Let's Welcome Each other! -

On this event, there is no host to welcome you.... So let's welcome each other :)

Some days before the event takes place, everyone will be asked to be there as close to 9Pm as possible.. This is all what's needed to make this event work out!

On the day of the event, Arjan will be online in order to respond to online comments on the event page.

- What more needs to be said? -

Let's make it happen :)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

- More Detailed Information -

- Vibes of the Culti Meetup Group -

This group is about what the attendees want it to be, more than anything else! none is bigger than the group.

The Culti Meetup Group has a wide range of activities, which are very different from area to area. In not one single area, Culti Group is "Cheap". Most of the time it's a social club for open minded people with an international mindset.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

=> A Godfried Schalcken painting

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

- RSVP Yes or No? -

A "Yes RSVP" for this event means you are reserving one of the available spots.

Feel free to reserve a spot if you want to be there, but if plans change, than please show some respect to organizers and other members of this group. Plus please clear the reservation for someone else.

All this also makes telling the venue owners how many people are going to be there a lot more easy :)
how_to_find_us: For finding the venue call (32) 2 548 4211. Ones inside look for the Meetup Sign.

description:
Welcome to next english Comedy Night!! On Tuesday, Feb 18th, we'll have a fine evening of international standup comedy with great comedians from around the world.

Le Bouche À Oreille

Rue Felix Hap, 11, 1040 Brussels, Belgium

Tickets : 20€ in presale, 25€ at the door.

Presale tickets via: https://ticketlib.chilipost.io/standupfeb


Damian Clark (Australia) - Damian burst into the UK & European comedy circuit in 2005 and within weeks was hailed ‘The Number 1 event to see’ and ‘Cream of the crop’. After several acclaimed TV performances in Australia plus two prestigious comedy awards under his belt, Damian moved to Ireland where teaming up with fellow comic Andrew Stanley, he wrote and co-starred in RTE TV’s I Dare Ya which was the highest rating debut of an Irish TV comedy show to date.


Tiernan Douieb (UK) - Comedian, writer and occasional mixer of herbal tea bags, his solo Edinburgh show in 2011 'Tiernan Douieb vs The World' received rave reviews. Tiernan is also known as one of the best MCs on the UK circuit and we are very fortunate to have him guest the show in Brussels tonight as a guest MC. 

Otto Kuhnle (GER) - Berlin-based Otto Kuhnle is a prime example of a versatile German entertainer and actor. He sings, dances, juggles, plays several instruments, does magic tricks and more. A legend in Germany and having made quite a name for himself on the UK circuit, we are honoured to have him grace our stage this evening. 

Eric Seufert (USA) – Since moving to Europe, Eric helped found Comedy Estonia, the first English-language comedy club in the former Soviet Union. Stand-up isn’t Eric’s only comedic outlet; he has trained in improv with the Upright Citizens Brigade (NYC) and Coldtowne Theater (Austin, TX) and written for such magazines as the Austinst, Political Derby, and Cracked.com. Eric currently lives and runs a comedy club in Berlin.

Els Vertongen (BEL) - One of the top rising stars in Europe, she is fresh of her New Act Competition win in Antwerp and primed for a stellar career in comedy. The talk of the town in Antwerp, we can't wait to see what she has in store for us in Brussels.


- Pasta corner from 7 PM onward

- entrance through place Van Meyel - http://goo.gl/maps/T337D

- mandatory coatcheck, but free of charge
how_to_find_us: rue Felix Hap 11, Brussels
name: Brussels English Comedy Night - Tues Feb 18

description:
* * * *

* * * *

- Brussels English Comedy Night -

Join us for another fantastic Brussels English comedy night on tues, april 15th. The entire show will be in English.

- I want this! -

Tickets online here:

https://ticketlib.chilipost.io/april2014(save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

- New in Town Service -

There will  a 'new in town' sign on one of the tables for those who are new in town! :)

* * * *  

* * * *

See the promo video of the show to see what it's like.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TtvEEewmz_g

Comics: 

Isak Jansson SWE
Isak Jansson is one of Sweden’s top international comedy acts. He has spread Swedish comedy all over the world in places like Russia, India, South Africa, Finland, France, Germany, Belgium, UK, Estonia, China, etc. His comedy style mixes observational comedy with an absurdist touch, all in a high energy physical stage persona. In 2013 he toured with his solo show "It´s the Flourist’s Fault". 

Brian Jordan USA
Brian is an American based in Sweden. He has seen the best of the best live at the famous Punchline in Atlanta, but Brian has developed his own style of storytelling comedy. They say that part truth is involved in most comedians’ stories, and Brian is no different. If you figure out which parts of his stories are true, they could shock you. He has been in commercials, lent his voice for audiobooks, and is looking forward to his first movie role, should one come along.

Claus Reiss DK
Best Bagpipe Comedy Show in Europe...…and the only one. The Danish comedian Claus Reiss is the only man in Europe who also entertains with the bagpipe. He uses the odd instrument to play well-known tunes, but in a most untraditional way. He spices up his performance with storytelling and jokes in a close interaction with the audience. Claus Reiss has been on the international comedy circuit for several years now attending some of the world’s biggest comedy festivals. His shows have made people laugh across Europe due to his surprising mixture of bagpipe music, comedy and improvisation.

Manu Moreau BEL
Is he a bird, is he a plane? Well, if he’s up that high, he must be insane! From a small township to the big city, he’s been there, done that and sold the t-shirt. His first steps in comedy weren’t so long ago, but every step since has been closely monitored for your safety. His comedy works similar to cocaine: one line after the other, very addictive.

Soula Notos GRE
Originally from Greece, but now based in Utrecht, she has fantastic energy on stage and a quick-wittedness only to adore and admire. Soula will be our host this evening and we can't wait to welcome her on stage to MC the show. 

Entrance through Place Van Meyel

Pasta corner on site too if you are hungry.
how_to_find_us: The venue is on just 200 meters from Metro Stop Merode. Ones inside, there will a meetup sign printed and taped on one of the tables in the room to the left of the bar, as well as a 'new in town' sign for those who are new in town.

description:
=> ENGLISH COMEDY NIGHT <=

Join us for English Comedy Night, May 20, 2014, with a superstar headliner that has received prestigious reviews and won many awards, Mr Tony Law (Can).

The entire show will be in English.

=> COSTS <=

it will be 25€ at the door - but you can save EUR 4 in presales!

presale tickets via: http://ticketlib.com/may2014

=> NEW IN TOWN SERVICE <=

There will be people coming from several meetup groups! So this is a good day to make new friends! There will be a meetup sign on some tables in the room to the left of the bar

 

Tony Law (CAN)

Tony is a surreal and unique stand-up comedian, who looks like a cross between a 1908 Olympic athlete and – his words – a 16th century Genoese sailor. His TV appearances include Never Mind The Buzzcocks, Stewart Lee’s Comedy Vehicle and Have I Got News For You. He is known for his highly surreal material and delivery, and 1950s Americana style of dress, favouring boots with turned-up jeans and a Viking/explorer style of hair.

Ahmed Berhan (SWE)

This African Swedish comedian is all energy and one of the foremost booked comics on the Scandinavian circuit, including a regular on the well-known Raw stage in Stockholm. His comedy is full of action and using all the stage, and his liveliness and quick-witted nature will leave you gasping for air between laughs.

David Hayden (IRE)

David Hayden is an Irish Comedian Based in Antwerp Belgium. He was shortlisted for BBC New Comedy Awards 2012 and Finalist for “Show me the funny 2011” Winner of (the much coveted) Battle of the Axe - Ha’ Penny Bridge Inn - Dublin 2010. He moved to Belgium in 2011 and started the “Cafe Manger Saturday Night Comedy “ where he MCs and presents local and International acts. He has supported some of the best comedians in Belgium, Ireland, Germany and the UK. As well as a regular on the Belgian Circuit he also brings English Speaking stand up comedy to Belgian schools.

Jeroen Pater (NL)

Jeroen is one of the foremost names in Dutch comedy and known as the godfather of the Utrecht comedy scene. Observational and twisted humour at its finest - he is a bit of a communications skills expert and we're looking forward to the magic he can work on the audience tonight.

Hosted by Joe Eagan (CAN)

Joe currently resides near Copenhagen and runs the English comedy club there. Founder of InternationalComedians.com, he is also very much a ‘behind the scenes’ kind of guy, organizing and co-organizing countless shows throughout Europe. On stage, he specializes in entertaining crowds with his unique perspective about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour you don't want to miss!

Entrance through Place Van Meyel

Pasta corner on site, cheap and tasty !

Like us on facebook : 

www.facebook.com/standupbrussels

Hire comics for events/parties - www.internationalcomedians.com

description:
* * * *

* * * *

- August Daytrip: The Hague in one day!  -

Let's meet at Eden Babylon Lounge Bar for a SPECIAL event! An event for which a lot of the Friends of Culti Group are invited! This event is lined up in 8 chapters of Culti Group!

The program is very simple: we all meet in the bar, together with some expats, long term residents and locals from The Hague Culti Arjan will make a plan - and off we go.

The day will end with EARLY DINNER at the BEACH!

- Coming from Antwerpen or Brussels -

The last train back to Belgium leaves around 20:30 PM - this means that if you come, going back from the beach around 19:30 PM is 100% save.

The Train Time from Brussels to The Hague is 150 minutes, the Traintime from Antwerpen is less.

Going by car will take around 100 minutes - maybe a bit more - it's sunday.

And IF you come by car... Than maybe drop a comment and ask people to come with you :)

- The Hall of Mirrors -

One atraction already is for certain! The House of Mirrors. Set the inner child free! Check this link out for seeing what we are talking about here :)

- But what if no one from The Hague shows up? -

This wont happen, but no worries, untill it was "'Time to move on" todays event host has studied Public Administration in.... The Hague! So the host kind of knows this city!

Keep on reading if you want to know all details, but maybe just be there ;)

* * * *

* * * *

- The Meetup Point -

On the picture above you can see in which building we will meet. On the picture below you can see where in the venue we will be: close but not at this bar.

* * * *

* * * *

- Program, costs and possible destinations -

The programm is simple: using the tram and so, we'll hop from one sight to see to the other sight to see. And when we have seen some, we'll go find a place to eat something :)

The costs are EUR 8,--, this is the fee for the host but you wont have to buy a ticket for the Hall or Mirrors. BTW,  please also pay a 10% tip on every shared bill. The host is spending ALL the money that he collects for Meetups only.

Once in The Hague, you can buy a DAYTICKET for Public transport - this will be costing you EUR 6,--. You can also just use your OV Chip Card.

The possible sights to see other than the House of Mirrors? Keep on reading :)

* * * *

-  Possible sights to see -

Maybe check out this LINK to get an idea of what is out there :)

Plus.... Check the pictures below :)

* * * *

* * * *

Picture above: Peace Palace

* * * *

Picture above: Museon

* * * *

Picture above: Kurhaus

* * * *
how_to_find_us: For finding the venue call 070-3814901.  Ones inside please ask for the hotel bar at the lobby, not for the meetup group. This Hotel is just in front of the main exit of Central Station The Hague.
name: Culti Daytrip August: "Hall of Mirrors" and More @ The Hague

description:
* * * *

* * * *

Join us on Tuesday, September 16th for the first Brussels English Comedy Night of the season. We have a great new season with lots of fantastic acts! We also have a new venue! 

When: Tues, Sept 16, Showtime: 20.00

Where: The Black Sheep, Chaussée de Boondael 8, Brussels 

(map: https://goo.gl/maps/F3wkL)

Advance tickets: 16 eur (available via: http://ticketlib.com/sept2014) 

Door Entry: 20 eur

Connect to each other: if you want to connect to each other, bring a smartphone! Culti Arjan will be online to help you connecting to each other :)  

 

 

Headlining this show is the incredible Benny Boot (Australia). Benny has been performing on the UK stand-up comedy circuit for over 8 years. He delivers his jokes in a unique style on variety of strange topics. His engaging persona & material keeps the laughter rolling through the entire show and is guaranteed to bring any audience undone. Edinburgh Festival (Pleasance Comedy Reserve - 2007; Just the Tonic Showcase - 2006); NBC’s Last Comic Standing (UK Finalist).

Also performing: Zeid Andersson (Sweden) - One of Scandinavia's top female comics, she won the One-liner of the year award in 2012 at the Stockholm Comedy Awards and is a member of the famous "A little damn women's movement" show.

Neil Robinson (Canada) Niel is one of the brightest future talents in Europe.

Jason Waddell (USA) - Taking Belgium by storm, this American, IT nerd by day, and experimental comic is an up and coming star of tomorrow. 

& your host Joe Eagan (Canada).www.englishcomedybrussels.com

Hire comics for events/parties: www.internationalcomedians.com

description:
* * * *

* * * *

Join us for the next Brussels English Comedy Night of the season with superstar Phil Nichol (CAN) + 4 other comics.

Advance tickets: 16 eur (available via: http://ticketlib.com/oct2014

Door Entry: 20 eur

Connect to each other: if you want to connect to each other, bring a smartphone! Culti Arjan will be online to help you connecting to each other :)  

Phil Nichol (Canada) is a truly unique performer. An acclaimed actor, award winning comedian, producer, presenter, writer and musician there is no end to his talent. Phil is an energetic and exciting performer with an unquenchable thirst to break boundaries and innovate with his work. His skill as an improviser whether it be musical, comedy or straight is unparalled. With a surreal edge to some of his mischievous rantings Nichol always brings something new to the stage, his keen sense of fun and eye for the shocking and absurd has cemented his position as one of the best comedians on the circuit today. His assured and award winning performances in his theatrical work have attracted critical accolades and see him in great demand as an actor.

SCOTSMAN FRINGE FIRST WINNER 2011; TIME OUT BEST COMEDY PERFORMER 1998

“You won‟t see many comedy shows that actually exert g-force. But if you‟re a passion junkie like me, there is no better place to get your fix than from Phil Nichol…exhilarating, incredibly funny and clever” The Scotsman

John Gilligan (USA) is a Las Vegas based comic who brings observational humor to new heights, with a very down to earth spin. He touches on subjects including a 25 year career in construction, being raised by 2 NY Police Officers, his military service during the cold war, hospitalization, and he claims to understand the female mind. Enjoy while he lays it on the line in proof of the old adage, "Tragedy + Time = Comedy"

Emma Wessleus (Sweden) was one of the fastest rising stars in Sweden before she moved to Amsterdam recently to pursue comedy and performing arts. We are honoured to have her join us for her first ever performance in Belgium. Truly a great Scandinavian talent not to miss!

+ our bonus new talent act this evening will be Juan Bayet (Colombia). 

& your host - Hank (NL) is one of the foremost hosts on the European circuit today. Don't miss this change to see this legend in action as he walks you through the evening and promises endless chuckles and giggles along the way.

Mark your calendars for our November 18 show too, same time, same place, 4 more comedians from around the world, including superstars Al Pitcher NZ and Ria Lina UK.

 presented by English Comedy Brussels and InternationalComedians.com

www.englishcomedybrussels.com

Hire comics for events/parties: www.internationalcomedians.com
